title: LME aluminium cash price rises to $2,878.5/t on October 27 as stocks dip to 469,275t
summary: LME aluminium prices climbed to $2,878.5 per tonne on October 27, supported by firm demand and a 3,850-tonne drop in exchange stocks to 469,275 tonnes. The 3-month bid price and December contract also recorded gains, while alumina prices were assessed at $319.16 per tonne.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum prices fell slightly to $2,872.55 per tonne on October 30, down 0.42% from the previous day, but have risen 6.50% over the past month and 9.43% year-over-year. Aluminum futures hit a 3-year high in October amid tight supply, influenced by China's output cap of 45 million tons.

title: Mexico & US make 90% progress in tariff negotiations, while steel and aluminum issues remain to be concluded
summary: Mexico and the US have made 90% progress in tariff negotiations, but issues related to steel and aluminum tariffs are still pending resolution. This ongoing negotiation could impact aluminum trade dynamics between the two countries.

title: Not Only Tariffs on Trucks: Trump Administration's Proclamation Amends the Tariff Landscape on Automobiles, Steel, and Aluminum
summary: The Trump Administration issued a proclamation reducing aluminum and steel tariffs by up to 25% for USMCA-qualifying suppliers operating in Canada or Mexico, aiming to support new US production capacity. This adjustment affects tariffs on aluminum imports and is part of broader efforts to create a domestic ecosystem in related industries.

title: SMM: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory Rises to 98,500 mt on Oct 31, 2025
summary: Domestic aluminum billet inventory in two key locations rose to 98,500 metric tons as of October 31, 2025. The Shanghai Futures Exchange (SHFE) aluminum price remains in an upward channel, reflecting ongoing market strength despite inventory increases.

title: A week of highs for the upstream aluminium industry – Prices, policies, and projects take the centre stage
summary: The upstream aluminium industry experienced record-high prices on the London Metal Exchange, strategic investments in bauxite projects, and a potential full-scale restart of a major US-based smelter. Supply concerns are driven by production caps in China and strong demand from green industries like electric vehicles.

title: US aluminum scrap trade faces 2025 shake-up amid tariffs and global demand
summary: US aluminum scrap imports rose 31% in the first half of 2025 despite new tariffs, reaching about 430,000 tonnes. However, the 25% aluminum import tariff effective March 12, 2025, caused recyclers to shift toward domestic recovery, reshaping the scrap trade dynamics.

title: Nothing should be left on table to keep Rio Tinto's aluminum smelter open, says Australian minister
summary: The Australian Minister emphasized that all possible measures should be taken to keep Rio Tinto's aluminum smelter operational, highlighting the importance of maintaining production capacity in the country.

title: SMM: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory Rises to 98,500 mt on Oct 31, 2025
summary: According to SMM statistics, the inventory of aluminum billet in two domestic locations increased to 98,500 metric tons as of October 31, 2025, indicating changes in supply and demand dynamics within the domestic aluminum market.

title: UAE Delivers First Batch of Low-Carbon Aluminium Powered by Nuclear Energy from Barakah
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium and Emirates Nuclear Energy Company have delivered the UAE’s first batch of low-carbon aluminium produced using clean electricity from the Barakah Nuclear Energy Plant. This aluminium, branded MinimAL, represents a significant step in decarbonising heavy industry by using nuclear power as a constant, carbon-free energy source. The product has been supplied to Egypt’s CANEX Aluminum, marking a milestone in cross-border clean industry collaboration.

title: Honeywell Unveils Breakthrough Technology to Produce Low-Cost, High-Quality Renewable Fuels from Biomass
summary: Honeywell announced a new Biocrude Upgrading technology that converts agricultural and forestry waste into renewable fuels such as marine fuel, gasoline, and sustainable aviation fuel. This technology offers a cost-effective, scalable solution for decarbonizing sectors like shipping and aviation by producing drop-in renewable fuels that require no engine modifications. It addresses key challenges of cost and feedstock availability, supporting India’s clean energy transition goals.

title: ASI Certifies Shandong Innovation Group Co., Ltd. Against Performance Standard V3.1 and Chain of Custody V2
summary: Shandong Innovation Group Co., Ltd. has been certified by the Aluminium Stewardship Initiative (ASI) against the latest sustainability standards for recycling, remelting aluminium scrap, and producing aluminium alloys. The certification covers multiple facilities in China with a combined annual production capacity exceeding five million tonnes. This recognition underscores the company's commitment to sustainable aluminium production and supports sectors like automotive lightweighting and electronics.

title: UAE Aluminum Curtain Wall Market Forecast & Opportunity Report 2025
summary: The UAE aluminum curtain wall market is projected to grow significantly, driven by urbanization and a rising demand for sustainable construction. A key trend is the adoption of smart facades integrating sensors, solar panels, and automated shading to optimize energy efficiency in buildings. This aligns with the UAE’s sustainability goals and is prompting innovation in high-performance aluminum curtain wall systems.

title: China Base Metals Demand 15th Five-Year Plan 2025 Guide
summary: China’s 15th Five-Year Plan emphasizes increased recycled aluminium use, energy efficiency, and technology upgrades to reduce carbon intensity in line with environmental policies. The plan supports a shift toward circular economy principles with a target to raise recycled nonferrous metals to 24% of total supply by 2025. These policies create price premiums and encourage innovation in aluminium recycling and sustainable production technologies.

title: Steel Price Update: Slight Daily Gain Amid Monthly Decline
summary: Steel prices in China rose to 3,092 CNY/T on October 31, up 0.13% from the previous day, but have fallen 0.10% over the past month and are down nearly 5% year-on-year. Analysts expect further declines, forecasting a price of 3,022.85 CNY/T by the end of the quarter and 2,890.00 CNY/T in 12 months.

title: HRC Steel Price Dips Slightly, Remains Up Sharply Year-on-Year
summary: Hot-rolled coil (HRC) steel fell to 844.08 USD/T on October 31, down 0.70% from the previous day, but prices are up 4.72% over the past month and 18.32% year-on-year. Forecasts suggest HRC steel may trade at 827.34 USD/T by the end of the quarter but could rise to 892.84 USD/T in a year.

title: China's Steel Consumption Falls 5.7% Year-on-Year in First Three Quarters of 2025
summary: China's steel consumption dropped 5.7% year-on-year in the first nine months of 2025, according to industry association data. This decline reflects ongoing weak domestic demand despite strong export growth earlier in the year.

title: US-China Trade Deal Optimism Fuels Asian Steel Production Surge, But October Slowdown Looms
summary: Asian steel production saw a surge from May to September 2025, peaking in August, driven by optimism over a potential US-China trade deal. However, October data shows a significant slowdown in overall plant activity, despite some Chinese producers maintaining high output levels, suggesting broader supply issues in the region.

title: worldsteel Short Range Outlook October 2025
summary: The World Steel Association projects global steel demand to remain flat in 2025 at 1,749 million tonnes, with a modest 1.3% rebound expected in 2026. Growth is anticipated in developing economies and Europe, while US demand is forecast to rise due to infrastructure spending and potential stimulus.

title: China's steel consumption in the first three quarters of 2025 fell 5.7% y/y, association says
summary: China's steel consumption dropped 5.7% year-on-year in the first three quarters of 2025, according to industry association data. This decline reflects ongoing challenges in the Chinese steel market amid broader economic pressures.

title: New BIOEDGE steel incorporates renewable biocarbon for lower emissions
summary: Steel Dynamics has launched innovative lower-embodied-carbon steel products named BIOEDGE™ and EDGE™, produced exclusively with electric arc furnace technology. BIOEDGE uses renewable biocarbon replacing traditional anthracite, significantly lowering Scope 1 emissions, and is paired with renewable energy certificates to reduce Scope 2 emissions, supporting sustainable manufacturing and decarbonization efforts.

title: BHP POSCO Partner on Near Zero Emissions Steel Technology
summary: BHP and POSCO have partnered to develop POSCO's HyREX hydrogen reduction ironmaking technology aimed at near-zero emissions steel production. A demonstration plant with 300,000 tonnes annual capacity is planned at Pohang Steelworks, targeting commissioning by early 2028, marking a significant step toward decarbonizing the steel industry.

title: Hydrogen-Based Low Emissions Iron: Tech & Benefits
summary: Hydrogen-based steel production technology is set to transform the global steel industry by enabling distributed production closer to end markets, reducing emissions and transportation costs. This shift favors renewable energy-rich regions and smaller, flexible facilities, with ongoing advancements in hydrogen production and integration with carbon capture systems promising further environmental benefits.

title: An actionable path to cutting carbon emissions in steel production
summary: Researchers at UCL developed a database and economic model identifying cost-effective strategies to reduce carbon emissions from nearly 4,900 steel plants worldwide. A medium pathway retrofitting approach could cut 22.4 billion tonnes of CO2 by 2050 at an average cost of $24.7 per tonne, balancing cost and impact while enabling significant emissions reductions.

title: Steel Tech 2025: The event where steel, technology and innovation shape its future
summary: STEEL TECH 2025 Congress & Expo gathered industry leaders and experts to discuss innovation and sustainability in steel production. The event focused on carbon-free energy sources, global raw material strategies, artificial intelligence, and innovative CO2 capture and valorisation solutions, highlighting the sector's commitment to sustainable transformation.

title: ENAMI's New Smelter Approved, LME Copper Fell Sharply Last Night [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: LME copper futures opened at $11,044/mt and closed at $10,930/mt, down 1.44%, with prices fluctuating downward during the session. Chilean state-owned ENAMI obtained environmental permits for a new $1.7 billion copper smelter capable of processing 850,000 mt of copper concentrates annually, modernizing its Hernan Videla Lira smelter in northern Atacama.

title: Copper Declines from 3-Month High
summary: US copper futures fell to $5.09 per pound from a three-month high of $5.17 due to a stronger dollar and uncertain demand outlook despite ongoing supply concerns. The easing of US-China trade barriers and a fatal mudslide at an Indonesian mine affecting over 3% of global supply also influenced market dynamics.

title: Copper Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Copper prices were volatile in Q3 2025, reaching record highs of $5.81 per pound on COMEX driven by tariff fears and supply-demand fundamentals. After a sharp decline in August, prices rebounded in September and early October, breaking above $5 per pound as supply fundamentals strengthened.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper prices fell to $5.06 per pound on October 31, down 0.43% from the previous day but remain near three-month highs. The market is influenced by US-China trade developments, a recent Fed rate cut, and ongoing supply disruptions from major miners and mine incidents in Chile and Indonesia.

title: Copper Price Rally Hits Record $11200 Per Ton in 2025
summary: Copper prices surpassed $11,200 per ton in 2025 amid supply disruptions and strong demand from the energy transition. Goldman Sachs projects prices to remain between $10,000 and $11,000 per ton in 2026-2027, balancing supply recovery and demand growth, while potential supply disruptions could push prices higher.

title: ENAMI's New Smelter Approved, LME Copper Fell Sharply Last Night
summary: Chilean state-owned ENAMI received environmental permits to build a new $1.7 billion copper smelter as part of modernizing its Hernan Videla Lira smelter in northern Atacama. The new facility will process up to 850,000 metric tons of copper concentrates annually and produce up to 240,000 metric tons of copper cathode via electrorefining.

title: Capstone Copper Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Capstone Copper reported Q3 2025 sulphide copper production of 44,904 tonnes at a C1 cash cost of $2.00/lb, a significant improvement from Q3 2024. The Pinto Valley Mine experienced a 29% production decline due to lower grades and mill throughput impacted by drought-related water constraints, but throughput improved in October 2025 with full mill operations resuming.

title: Copper Declines from 3-Month High
summary: US copper futures fell from a three-month high due to a stronger dollar and uncertain demand outlook despite ongoing supply concerns. Supply shocks include lower output from major miners like Glencore and Anglo American and a halt in operations at a Freeport-McMoRan mine in Indonesia responsible for over 3% of global supply.

title: Eurasian Resources Mercuria Copper Deal: $100M Agreement
summary: Eurasian Resources and Mercuria signed a $100 million strategic agreement focusing on copper production capacity in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The deal supports annual output exceeding 200,000 tonnes and integrates mining with on-site processing, impacting global supply and spot market dynamics by stabilizing contracted volumes over three years.

title: Ivanhoe Mines Plans Angola Copper Drill Program by Q4 2025
summary: Ivanhoe Mines announced a 6,400-meter diamond drilling campaign in Angola's Moxico and Cuando Cubango provinces starting Q4 2025. This marks the company's first major copper exploration in Angola following permit acquisition in 2023, aiming to expand its footprint in Africa’s copper sector amid strong global demand driven by renewable energy and electrification.

title: Patriot Expands Copper-Gold Footprint in Zambia
summary: Patriot Resources expanded its copper-gold footprint within the Kitumba Project in Zambia after completing a phase one trenching program. The company identified a potential 200m strike zone and is preparing for ground magnetics and induced polarisation surveys to map subsurface sulphidic zones, advancing its exploration efforts.

title: World Copper Announces Closing of Sale of Zonia Copper Project
summary: World Copper Ltd. completed the sale of its Zonia Copper Project in Arizona to Edge Copper Corporation for $10.5 million in cash and shares, resulting in World Copper owning approximately 31.3% of Edge Copper. The transaction was finalized under a court-approved plan of arrangement.

title: Arca Climate Technologies inks 10-year carbon removal offtake deal with Microsoft
summary: Arca Climate Technologies signed a 10-year carbon removal offtake agreement with Microsoft, focusing on repurposing mining byproducts like tailings and waste rock to accelerate carbon mineralization. This process transforms CO2 into solid minerals, providing durable carbon removal, reducing mine waste, and creating jobs, with plans to scale from pilot projects to million-tonne operations.

title: Industrial Metals Navigate a Bifurcated Market Amidst China's Slowdown and Green Revolution
summary: The industrial metals market in 2025 is shaped by the global energy transition and AI demand, driving a projected 40% increase in copper demand by 2030. This structural shift impacts manufacturing, construction, and technology sectors, with green technologies gaining advantage despite challenges like tariffs and China's property slump.

title: Copper and Copper Alloy Scrap and Recycling Market Forecast Report 2025-2034
summary: The global copper scrap and recycling market, valued at $42.4 billion in 2024, is expected to grow at a CAGR of 10.2%, reaching $76.6 billion by 2034. Copper scrap is vital for sustainability, reducing primary mining needs, with strong demand from electrical and electronics sectors due to copper's conductivity and recyclability.

title: Gold and Copper: The Unseen Forces Powering Market Returns
summary: Copper prices have surged over 27% in 2025, driven by sustained demand from green energy and digital transformation. Market experts like BlackRock suggest copper's price rise reflects a fundamental supply-demand imbalance, indicating a new higher baseline for copper driven by decarbonization and digitalization trends.

title: Ucore Comments on G7 Focus to Secure Critical Mineral Supply Chains
summary: Ucore Rare Metals highlights the importance of securing critical mineral supply chains, including rare earths essential for clean energy and manufacturing. The company emphasizes government-backed frameworks to reduce price volatility and accelerate domestic supply, supporting sustainable and scalable refining technologies.

title: Nickel prices dropped slightly on October 31 while spot premiums strengthened
summary: On October 31, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged between 120,500 and 123,400 yuan/mt, averaging 121,950 yuan/mt, which was down 250 yuan/mt from the previous day. Despite the slight price drop, spot premiums showed signs of strengthening.

title: Vale Posts Net Profit Beat and Cuts Copper, Nickel Cost Outlook
summary: Brazilian mining giant Vale reported a stronger-than-expected net profit for the quarter and lowered its cost outlook for copper and nickel production. This development suggests potential stabilization of nickel prices around $8.00 per pound amid operational efficiencies and fluctuating global demand.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices were volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized in Q3 amid ongoing oversupply concerns. Prices ranged mostly between $15,000 and $15,500 per metric ton, with market uncertainty influenced by US trade policies and the end of the EV tax credit.

title: Nickel prices Q3 2025 review: China restocking lifts sulphate and MHP as LME oversupply persists
summary: During Q3 2025, nickel prices remained at five-year lows due to persistent oversupply on the London Metal Exchange, although restocking in China helped lift prices for nickel sulphate and mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP). The market continues to face supply-demand imbalances despite these regional demand boosts.

title: Eramet’s Weda Bay nickel ore sales surge in Q3 after RKAB revision
summary: French mining group Eramet reported a sharp rebound in nickel ore sales from its Weda Bay operations in Indonesia during the third quarter, following a revision to its mining work plan (RKAB). The article notes a significant increase in sales volume, though full details require a login to access.

title: Ceria Group Produces First Green Nickel, Pushes Ahead with Smelter Expansion
summary: PT Ceria Nugraha Indotama (Ceria Group) has commenced production of green nickel at its smelter in Indonesia and is continuing with expansion plans. This marks a milestone in Indonesia's push toward more sustainable nickel production.

title: Nickel x Biomining
summary: World Fund explores innovative climate tech solutions to reduce the high carbon emissions of nickel production, which currently exceeds those of copper, aluminum, and lithium. The article highlights the need for new supply chains or refining processes to ensure resilient, low-cost, and low-emission nickel supply, especially given the concentration of production in China and Indonesia. Two promising innovation pathways and startups in alternative nickel production are discussed.

title: What if an EV was made without metals or minerals?
summary: Sandvik unveiled an electric car made without metals or minerals to highlight the critical role of mining in sustainable development and the green transition. The article emphasizes the need to scale sustainable mining practices for lithium, nickel, and cobalt to meet net-zero goals by 2050. It also describes the future of mining as autonomous, electrified, and digitalized to optimize resource extraction with minimal environmental impact.

title: Cobalt-Free EV Cathodes: Sustainable Battery Solutions
summary: Research on cobalt-free cathodes, including nickel-iron-aluminium compositions, aims to reduce reliance on critical materials like cobalt and nickel in EV batteries. The article discusses technical challenges such as performance optimization and manufacturing scaling, alongside government policy support to promote sustainable battery technologies. Advances in battery recycling and circular economy approaches are also highlighted.

title: Critical Minerals Production Alliance: Global Strategy
summary: The alliance focuses on sustainable competitive advantages through technology innovation, environmental standards, and transparent market mechanisms for critical minerals including nickel. It emphasizes supply chain traceability using blockchain and digital certification to ensure ethical sourcing and quality. The strategy aims to diversify supply, reduce price volatility, and create high-tech jobs in refining, processing, and environmental remediation.

title: PT Vale Delivers Strong 3Q25 Performance Driven by Higher Production and Successful Start of Bahodopi Operations
summary: PT Vale reported strong third-quarter 2025 results, highlighting its leadership in sustainability within the nickel industry. The company achieved higher production and successfully started operations at the Bahodopi mine, reinforcing its commitment to sustainable mining practices and environmental stewardship.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali, a leading Italian steel producer, has started the pilot phase of its green hydrogen project at its Aosta plant. The project uses a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer to produce green hydrogen, aiming to reduce carbon emissions and power one of its 70 furnaces entirely. This initiative is supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, as part of its efforts to innovate in stainless steel and specialty steel manufacturing with sustainable technologies.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from certified renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali SpA Announces Its Commitment to Sustainability with ResponsibleSteel™ Certification
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has embarked on the ResponsibleSteel™ certification process for its Aosta site, formalizing its commitment to sustainable steel production. The certification reflects the company's dedication to environmental responsibility, transparency, and creating lasting value for stakeholders.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Tenaris posts 2% rise in quarterly net sales
date: Not specified (article published after Tenaris's Q3 results, which were released late on Wednesday)
summary: Tenaris, the Italian steel pipe maker, reported a 2% increase in net sales for the third quarter, driven by higher sales volumes. The company remains the world's leading producer of steel pipes for the oil and gas industries, with the majority of its sales in North America.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia as part of the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa, enhancing energy security and supporting cleaner energy transitions.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian reported third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, beating consensus estimates, driven by strong growth in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids units. The company raised its full-year 2025 guidance, supported by a stable high-voltage backlog of about €16 billion and solid organic growth in key segments.

title: Prysmian upgrades 2025 guidance
summary: Following strong performance in the first nine months of 2025, Prysmian upgraded its full-year guidance, citing excellent contributions from its Transmission business and North American region. The company emphasizes its leadership in cable solutions and its strategic focus on energy transition and digital transformation.

title: Prysmian Could Be a Relative Winner From Trump's Copper Tariff
date: No specific date in past 24 hours
summary: Citi analysts suggest Prysmian could benefit from President Trump's proposed 50% tariff on copper due to its vertically integrated copper operations in the U.S., giving it a competitive edge over smaller players. This could positively impact Prysmian's stock performance in the short term.
